roles.name: Software Developer
roles.description: Designs, writes, and tests code for applications, systems, or user-facing platforms.

meta.typicalBackground: Computer science or related field, proficiency in programming languages, debugging, and version control
challenges: Rapid technology changes, cross-team coordination, ensuring code security and performance

sampleUseCase.scenario: A developer implements a microservices architecture for a fintech startup, enabling feature updates without disrupting other modules and speeding up deployment cycles.

roles.name: Systems Architect
roles.description: Designs the overarching structure of IT solutions, ensuring scalability, security, and alignment with business goals.

meta.typicalBackground: Computer science, extensive systems integration experience, knowledge of cloud/hybrid environments
keyTools: Architecture diagrams (UML), cloud platform management, containerization orchestration (Kubernetes)
challenges: Legacy system integration, data privacy concerns, balancing cost vs. performance

sampleUseCase.scenario: A systems architect designs a hybrid cloud environment connecting on-prem HR data to a secure AWS instance, improving data availability and disaster recovery while meeting compliance.

roles.name: Data Scientist
roles.description: Extracts insights from complex data sets using machine learning, statistical analysis, and domain knowledge.

meta.typicalBackground: Math, statistics, or CS background, strong Python/R, ML frameworks, data storytelling skills
challenges: Ensuring data quality, scaling ML models, bridging business context with algorithmic results

sampleUseCase.scenario: A data scientist predicts customer churn for a subscription service using random forest models, enabling targeted retention campaigns that reduce churn by 10%.

roles.name: Cybersecurity Specialist
roles.description: Protects networks, systems, and data from cyber threats. Conducts risk assessments, implements security protocols, and leads incident response.

meta.typicalBackground: IT security certifications (CISSP, CEH), knowledge of threat intelligence, encryption, and compliance standards
challenges: Constantly evolving threat landscape, internal user vulnerabilities, budget prioritization

sampleUseCase.scenario: A cybersecurity specialist detects unusual login attempts from a foreign IP. They quarantine the affected user account, run a forensic check, and patch a discovered vulnerability.

roles.name: DevOps Engineer
roles.description: Bridges development and operations, automating build, test, and deployment pipelines to streamline software delivery.

meta.typicalBackground: Software engineering background with system admin/ops experience, knowledge of CI/CD best practices
keyTools: Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins pipelines, AWS or Azure DevOps platforms
challenges: Cultural shift to agile/DevOps, ensuring environment consistency, complex multi-cloud or on-prem setups

sampleUseCase.scenario: A DevOps engineer implements container orchestration with Kubernetes, drastically reducing deployment errors and enabling canary releases for safer feature rollouts.
